bibl.title: Military Orders for Albert E. Truby, August 20, 1899

div1.p: Truby is relieved from the Eighth Infantry; he is to report to the post surgeon for duty.

div1.head: Military Orders for Albert E. Truby, August 20, 1899
div1.opener:
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
HEADQUARTERS COLUMBIA BARRACKS,
Columbia Barracks, Cuba, Aug. 20, 1899.
Special Orders,)
No.136.)
Extract.
div1.p:
5. 1st Lieutenant A. E. Truby, Ass't Surgeon U.S.Army,is hereby
relieved from duty with the 8th Infantry, and will report to the
Post Surgeon for duty.

Lieutenant Truby will turn over to Acting Assistant Surgeon
H.L.Taylor, U.S. Army, such medical stores and property as is considered
necessary.
div1.closer:
By order of COLONEL RANDALL: T H Sargent
Captain & Adjutant, 8th Infantry,
Adjutant.
Lieut Truby A. S. U.S.A.
